{{DISPLAYTITLE:List of ''Star Wars'' characters}} {{rewrite|date=November 2010}} {{Refimprove|list|date=October 2008}} <!--Please be mindful of WP:NOT#PLOT when adding or expanding on content here. In almost every instance, Wookieepedia and Lucasfilm's Star Wars Databank have the space and editorial focus for an in-universe treatment; Wikipedia is generally better off providing a brief blurb here and offering links to these other sites-->
This is an incomplete list of prominent characters from the ''[[Star Wars]]'' franchise, sorted by last name. {{CompactTOC7}} ;http://newstarwars2.weebly.com ==#== ;2-1B : Medical droid who treats Luke Skywalker's wounds and fits him with a prosthetic hand in ''[[Star Wars Episode V: The Empire Strikes Back]]''.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.starwars.com/databank/droid/tooonebee/|title=2-1B (Too-Onebee)|publisher=[[Lucasfilm]]|accessdate=2008-10-08}}</ref> ;4-LOM â portrayed by Chris Parsons: A bounty hunter droid in ''The Empire Strikes Back''. 4-LOM was an ambitious protocol droid who overwrote his own programming to embark on a life of crime.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.starwars.com/databank/droid/fourlom/|title=4-LOM|publisher=[[Lucasfilm]]|accessdate=2008-10-08}}</ref> ;8D8 : An 8D smelter droid working in [[Jabba the Hutt]]'s palace in ''[[Star Wars Episode VI: Return of the Jedi]]''.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.starwars.com/databank/droid/atedeate/|title=8D8 (Atedeate)|publisher=[[Lucasfilm]]|accessdate=2008-10-08}}</ref> ;8t88 : A droid working with [[#J|Jerec]] in ''[[Star Wars Jedi Knight: Dark Forces II]]''.
==A== ;[[Admiral Ackbar]] â portrayed by [[Timothy M. Rose]] and voiced by Erik Bauersfeld : Commands the Rebel fleet in their attack against the second Death Star in ''[[Return of the Jedi]]''. Ackbar was a Mon Calamari leader and military commander. Aptly given a name that means "selfless servant," Ackbar devoted himself to the cause of galactic freedom and became the foremost military commander of the Alliance to Restore the Republic, having previously been an Imperial slave, and the later New Republic. He later dies during the New Jedi Order era, during the Yuuzhan Vong invasion .<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.starwars.com/databank/character/admiralackbar/|title=Ackbar, Admiral|publisher=[[Lucasfilm]]|accessdate=2008-10-07}}</ref> ;Stass Allie â portrayed by Lily Nyamwasa and Nina Fallon : Tholothian Jedi Master and Jedi Council member in ''[[Star Wars Episode II: Attack of the Clones]]'' and ''[[Star Wars Episode III: Revenge of the Sith]]''. ;[[PadmÃ© Amidala]] â portrayed by [[Natalie Portman]] : Child queen of, and later Senator from, [[Naboo]], who marries [[Anakin Skywalker]] and dies giving birth to [[Luke Skywalker]] and [[Leia Organa]]. The birth of Luke and Leia was further complicated by Anakin Skywalker's use of Force Choke in anger on Amidala, believing she had betrayed him when Obi-wan Kenobi confronts Anakin.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.starwars.com/databank/character/amidala/|title=Amidala, PadmÃ©|publisher=[[Lucasfilm]]|accessdate=2008-10-07}}</ref> ;Mas Amedda â portrayed by [[Jerome Blake]] and [[David Bower]]s : Vice chair of the Galactic Senate.<ref name="masamedda">{{cite web|url=http://www.starwars.com/databank/character/masamedda/|title=Amedda, Mas|publisher=[[Lucasfilm]]|accessdate=2008-10-07}}</ref> Blake played the character in ''[[Star Wars Episode I: The Phantom Menace]]'', Bowers played him in ''[[Star Wars Episode II: Attack of the Clones]]'', and both actors appeared in the role for ''[[Star Wars Episode III: Revenge of the Sith]]''.<ref name="masamedda" /> ;Nom Anor : a Yuuzhan Vong character prominent throughout ''The New Jedi Order'' series of novels, published from 1999 to 2003. He was responsible for about half of the Yuuzhan Vong invasion of the ''Star Wars'' galaxy, but in the latter half of the ''The New Jedi Order'', he became a protagonist in his own right as he led a heretical movement among his people to take down his ruler, Supreme Overlord Shimrra. ;Bail Antilles: An [[Alderaan]]ian senator. ''Sundered Heart'' owner.<ref name="bailorgana">{{cite web|url=http://www.starwars.com/databank/character/bailorgana/|title=Organa, Bail|publisher=[[Lucasfilm]]|accessdate=2008-10kille08}}</ref> ;Raymus Antilles â portrayed by Rohan Nichol and Peter Geddis : Captain of the ''[[Tantive IV]]'' in ''[[Star Wars Episode III: Revenge of the Sith]]'' and ''[[Star Wars Episode IV: A New Hope|Episode IV: A New Hope]]'', and as captain of the ''Sundered Heart'' in the game ''[[Star Wars: Empire at War]]''. He was choked by [[Darth Vader]] in Episode IV. No relation to Wedge Antilles. ;[[Wedge Antilles]] â portrayed by [[Denis Lawson]] and [[Colin Higgins]]: A Rebel and New Republic starfighter pilot.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.starwars.com/databank/character/wedgeantilles/|title=Wedge Antilles|publisher=[[Lucasfilm]]|accessdate=2008-10-07}}</ref> ;Queen Breha Antilles Organa â portrayed by [[Rebecca Jackson Mendoza]] : Ruler of Alderaan, wife of Bail Organa, and adoptive mother of Leia Organa. ;Tavion Axmis: Antagonist in ''[[Star Wars Jedi Knight: Jedi Academy]]''.
==B== ;B4-D4 : The administrative droid that works for Czerka on Telos in the Outer Rim. It is possible to control B4-D4 in ''[[Star Wars: Knights of the Old Republic II The Sith Lords]]'' while helping the Ithorians with their restoration project. ;Ponda Baba: - portrayed by Tommy Ilsley : [[List of Star Wars races (A-E)#Aqualish|Aqualish]] mercenary who attacks Luke Skywalker in ''A New Hope''.<ref name="ponda">{{cite web|url=http://www.starwars.com/databank/character/pondababa/|title=Baba, Ponda|publisher=[[Lucasfilm]]|accessdate=2008-10-07}}</ref> When the original [[Kenner]] [[action figure]] for Baba was released, the then-unnamed alien was called simply "Walrus Man".<ref name="ponda" /> His proper name (as well as the name of his species) was given in 1989 for his appearance in a [[Star Wars role-playing game]].<ref name="ponda" /> ;[[Cad Bane]] â voiced by [[Corey Burton]] : A ruthless bounty hunter and main antagonist in season 2 of ''[[Star Wars: The Clone Wars (2008 TV series)|The Clone Wars]]'' who appears in ''[[Star Wars: The Clone Wars: Republic Heroes]]''.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://xbox360.gamespy.com/articles/975/975716p1.html |title=GameSpy: Clone Wars Co-Op Coming? â Page 1 |publisher=Xbox360.gamespy.com |date=2009-04-23 |accessdate=2010-06-02}}</ref> ;[[Darth Bane]] : Dark lord of the Sith in the Darth Bane book series. He came up with the Sith rule of two that states there shall only ever be two sith warriors at a time, a master and an apprentice. ;Garm Bel Iblis: A Republic senator and initial member of the [[Rebel Alliance]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.starwars.com/databank/character/garmbeliblis/|title=Bel Iblis, Garm|publisher=[[Lucasfilm]]|accessdate=2008-10-07}}</ref> ;Sio Bibble â portrayed by [[Oliver Ford Davies]] : Governor of [[Naboo]] in the prequel trilogy.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.starwars.com/databank/character/siobibble/|title=Bibble, Sio|publisher=[[Lucasfilm]]|accessdate=2008-10-07}}</ref> ;Depa Billaba â portrayed by [[Dipika O'Neill Joti]] : Jedi Master on the Jedi High Council. Was sent to Haruun Kal by the council. She fell to the dark side and fell into a coma.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.starwars.com/databank/character/depabillaba/|title=Billaba, Depa|publisher=[[Lucasfilm]]|accessdate=2008-10-07}}</ref> ;[[Jar Jar Binks]] â portrayed by [[Ahmed Best]] : Helpless but good-natured Gungan throughout the prequel trilogy. Also known to be clumsy, Jar Jar Binks is always causing trouble and he talks a lot.When Qui-Gon Jinn saved Jar Jar Binks, Jar Jar Binks journeyed with them to the Republic.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.starwars.com/explore/encyclopedia/characters/jarjarbinks/|title=Binks, Jar Jar|publisher=[[Lucasfilm]]|accessdate=2011-10-03}}</ref> ;Deliah Blue: A companion of Cade Skywalker and Jariah Syn during the Sith-Imperial War in the ''Legacy'' comic series. ;Blue Max: Droid that is part of Han Solo's crew in ''[[The Han Solo Adventures]]'' by [[Brian Daley]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.starwars.com/databank/droid/bluemax/|title=Blue Max|publisher=[[Lucasfilm]]|accessdate=2008-10-08}}</ref> ;Commander Bly : A clone commander who led the 327th Star Corps under Jedi General Aayla Secura in [[Clone Wars (Star Wars)|Star Wars: The Clone Wars]] and in [[Star Wars: Revenge of the Sith]]. When Order 66 was issued, Bly executed Secura. ;Bossk â portrayed by Alan Harris : A Trandoshan bounty hunter in ''The Empire Strikes Back''.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.starwars.com/databank/character/bossk/|title=Bossk|publisher=[[Lucasfilm]]|accessdate=2008-10-07}}</ref> He also appeared in the book ''[[Tales from the Bounty Hunters]]'', the books of the ''[[Bounty Hunter Wars]]'' trilogy, in the story "The Prize Pelt", and in ''[[Star Wars: Empire at War: Forces of Corruption]]''. ;Bollux : Droid that is part of Han Solo's crew in ''The Han Solo Adventures'' by [[Brian Daley]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.starwars.com/databank/droid/bollux/|title=Bollux|publisher=[[Lucasfilm]]|accessdate=2008-10-08}}</ref> ;Borvo the Hutt â voiced by [[Clint Bajakian]] : A [[Hutt (Star Wars)|Hutt]] smuggler on [[Tatooine]] featured in ''[[Star Wars: Episode I: The Phantom Menace]]''. ;Noa Briqualon â portrayed by [[Wilford Brimley]] : Marooned on Endor in ''[[Ewoks: The Battle for Endor]]''.<ref>{{cite web|url= http://www.starwars.com/databank/character/noa/|title=Briqualon, Noa|publisher=[[Lucasfilm]]|accessdate=2008-10-07}}</ref> ;Maris Brood - Portrayed by [[Adrienne Wilkinson]] : Jedi in ''The Force Unleashed''. Starkiller spares her life on Felucia.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.starwars.com/databank/character/marisbrood/|title=Brood, Maris|publisher=[[Lucasfilm]]|accessdate=2010-10-25}}</ref>
==C== ;[[C-3PO]] â portrayed by [[Anthony Daniels]] : Protocol droid who appears throughout the Star Wars films and Expanded Universe.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.starwars.com/databank/droid/c3po/|title=C-3PO (See-Threepio)|publisher=[[Lucasfilm]]|accessdate=2008-10-07}}</ref> ;CB-99 : [[Jabba the Hutt]] used to keep his will. After his death shortly before the Battle of Endor, Zorba the Hutt, Jabba's father, reclaimed Jabba's will and everything he owned through the droid. He was first featured in the novel ''[[Zorba the Hutt's Revenge]]''. ;Joruus C'baoth : Insane clone of Jedi master Jorus C'baoth and an antagonist in Timothy Zahn's Thrawn trilogy.<ref name="cbaoth">{{cite web|url= http://www.starwars.com/databank/character/joruuscbaoth/|title=C'baoth, Joruus|publisher=[[Lucasfilm]]|accessdate=2008-10-07}}</ref> Zahn originally conceived the character as an insane clone of Obi-Wan Kenobi.<ref name="cbaoth"/> [[UGO Network|UGO Network's]] Adam Rosenburg listed Joruus as the 4th worst ''Star Wars'' Expanded Universe character, heavily criticising the way his name was formed from the character he was cloned from.<ref name="WorstEU">{{cite web |url=http://www.ugo.com/games/star-wars-expanded-universe-characters-worst |title=The Worst Star Wars Expanded Universe Characters |author=Adam Rosenburg |date=6 December 2008 |work=[[UGO Networks]] |accessdate=23 May 2011}}</ref> ;[[Jacen Solo|Darth Caedus]] : Sith Lord born as [[Jacen Solo]], the oldest son of [[Han Solo]] and [[Princess Leia Organa|Leia Organa Solo]] and [[Jaina Solo]]'s twin brother. ;[[Lando Calrissian]] â portrayed by [[Billy Dee Williams]] : Old friend of [[Han Solo]]. Businessman and scoundrel who leads the Rebels' space attack against the Death Star in ''Return of the Jedi''.<ref name="lando">{{cite web|url= http://www.starwars.com/databank/character/landocalrissian/|title=Calrissian, Lando|publisher=[[Lucasfilm]]|accessdate=2008-10-07}}</ref> He eventually resigns his military commission and returns to being a businessman.<ref name="lando"/> ;Charal : Force-wielding antagonist in ''Battle for Endor''.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.starwars.com/databank/character/charal/|title=Charal|publisher=[[Lucasfilm]]|date=2008-10-07}}</ref> ;[[Chewbacca]] â portrayed by [[Peter Mayhew]] : [[Han Solo]]'s partner and co-pilot of the ''[[Millennium Falcon]]''.<ref name="chewie">{{cite web|url=http://www.starwars.com/databank/character/chewbacca/|title=Chewbacca|publisher=[[Lucasfilm]]|date=2008-10-07}}</ref> His father, Attichitucuk, appears as a playable character in ''[[Star Wars: Galactic Battlegrounds]]''. Chewbacca and his wife, Mallatobuck, have a son named Lumpawarrump.<ref name="chewie" /> ;Chief Chirpa - portrayed by Jane Busby : Chief of the Ewoks on the forest moon of Endor in ''Return of the Jedi''. ;Nas Choka: Yuuzhan Vong warmaster who succeeded Tsavong Lah. Surrendered on behalf of the Yuuzhan Vong after Shimrra's death, ending the conflict. ;Captain Jeremoch Colton - portrayed by [[Jeremy Bulloch]] : Pilot of the ''Tantive IV'' in ''Revenge of the Sith'' ;Commander Cody : Served directly under [[Obi-Wan Kenobi]] in ''Revenge of the Sith''. He helps him at Utapau against General Grievous then turns on him when [[Palpatine|Emperor Palpatine]] orders him to "Execute order 66". Commander Cody is also featured in the Clone Wars cartoon series. It is a mystery what happened to him after order 66, although it is believed he went rogue. ;Darth Cognus : Sith Lord trained by Darth Bane and Darth Zannah. She would later train Darth Millenial. ;CordÃ© : PadmÃ© Amidala's decoy in ''Attack of the Clones''. She gets killed by Zam Wessel in her attempt to assassinate Senator Amidala. ;General Airen Cracken : Rebel and New Republic intelligence officer. [[West End Games]] ''Star Wars'' roleplaying supplements sometimes were published as "Cracken's" guides to their topic. ;Arvel Crynyd â portrayed by [[Hilton McRae]] : [[A-wing]] pilot who crashes into the [[Star Dreadnought]] ''Executor'', causing its fall and destruction on the surface of the Second Death Star, in ''Return of the Jedi'' ;Salacious B. Crumb â portrayed by Tim Rose and voiced by [[Mark Dodson]] : [[List of Star Wars races (K-O)#Kowakian Monkey-Lizard|Kowakian monkey-lizard]] in Jabba the Hutt's court.<ref name="crumb">{{cite web|url=http://www.starwars.com/databank/character/salaciouscrumb/|title=Crumb, Salacious|publisher=[[Lucasfilm]]|date=2008-10-08}}</ref> Rose's antics controlling the Crumb puppet led to an increase in the character's prominence.<ref name="crumb" />
==D== ;Admiral Natasi Daala : Antagonist introduced in the ''[[Jedi Academy]]'' trilogy, returning in ''[[Darksaber]]'', ''[[Planet of Twilight]]'', and ''[[Death Star (novel)|Death Star]]''.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.starwars.com/databank/character/admiraldaala/|title=Daala, Admiral Natasi|publisher=[[Lucasfilm]]|date=2008-10-08}}</ref> In the Legacy of the Force series, Daala becomes the chief of state of the Galactic Federation of Free Alliances. ;Biggs Darklighter â portrayed by [[Garrick Hagon]] : [[Luke Skywalker]]'s friend from [[Tatooine]] who helps in attacking the [[Death Star]].<ref name="biggs">{{cite web|url=http://www.starwars.com/databank/character/biggsdarklighter/|title=Darklighter, Biggs (Red Three)|publisher=[[Lucasfilm]]|date=2008-10-08}}</ref> Biggs' reunion with Luke was cut from the theatrical release of ''A New Hope'' but restored for the Special Edition release.<ref name="biggs" /> ;Dengar â portrayed by Morris Bush : [[Corellian]] bounty hunter who appeared in ''The Empire Strikes Back''.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.starwars.com/databank/character/dengar/|title=Dengar|publisher=[[Lucasfilm]]|date=2010-04-21}}</ref> ;{{anchor|Bren Derlin}}Bren Derlin â portrayed by [[John Ratzenberger]]: Rebel officer in ''The Empire Strikes Back''.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.starwars.com/databank/character/majorbrenderlin/|title=Derlin, Major Bren|publisher=[[Lucasfilm]]|date=2008-10-08}}</ref> ;Ima-Gun Di â portrayed by [[Robin Atkin Downes]]: Jedi Master in Star Wars: The Clone Wars. ;Desann â voiced by Mark Klastorin: [[Dark Jedi]] antagonist in ''[[Star Wars Jedi Knight II: Jedi Outcast]]''. ;Grand Moff Vilim Disra: Imperial antagonist in the ''[[Hand of Thrawn]]'' duology and in the novel ''[[Allegiance (novel)|Allegiance]]''. ;Teneniel Djo: Witch of Dathomir appearing in ''[[The Courtship of Princess Leia]]''. Married to Isolder, mother of Tenel Ka. Related to Jedi Master Cormac Bloomfield ;{{anchor|Jan Dodonna}}Jan Dodonna â portrayed by [[Alex McCrindle]] : Rebel general who plans the starfighter attack on the first [[Death Star]],<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.starwars.com/databank/character/generaljandodonna/|title=Dodonna, Jan|publisher=[[Lucasfilm]]|accessdate=2008-10-08}}</ref> and the first character to utter the phrase, "[[May the Force be with you]]". ;[[Count Dooku]] â portrayed by [[Christopher Lee]] : Separatist leader and Sith apprentice also known as ''Darth Tyranus''.<ref name="dooku">{{cite web|url=http://www.starwars.com/databank/character/countdooku/|title=Dooku, Count|publisher=[[Lucasfilm]]|accessdate=2008-10-08}}</ref> Dooku severs Anakin Skywalker's right forearm in ''Attack of the Clones'', and Skywalker kills Dooku in ''Revenge of the Sith'' by severing his head--AFTER severing both of Dooku's hands at the wrist--in return.<ref name="dooku" /> ;DormÃ© â portrayed by [[Rose Byrne]] : The handmaiden to Senator [[PadmÃ© Amidala]], in ''[[Star Wars: Episode II - Attack of the Clones]]''.<ref name="sabe">{{cite web|url=http://www.starwars.com/databank/character/dorm/|title=DormÃ©|publisher=[[Lucasfilm]]|accessdate=2011-03-16}}</ref> ;Grand Moff Dunhausen: A high-ranking Imperial officer and member of the Central Committee of Grand Moffs. Dunhausen is predominantly known for two things: his scheming nature and for always wearing a pair of blaster-shaped earrings. He owns the droid 3B6-RA-7. He is first featured in the novel ''[[The Glove of Darth Vader]]''. ;Captain Dunwell: Assists Trioculus in his search for [[Darth Vader]]'s glove. Killed after his submarine explodes. First featured in the novel ''[[The Glove of Darth Vader]]''. ;Durge â voiced by Daran Norris : A character in the 2003 ''[[Star Wars: Clone Wars (2003 TV series)|Clone Wars]]'' animated series.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.starwars.com/databank/character/durge/|title=Durge|publisher=[[Lucasfilm]]|accessdate=2008-10-08}}</ref> ;Kyp Durron: Jedi Master who first appears in [[Kevin J. Anderson]]'s ''Jedi Academy'' Trilogy.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.starwars.com/databank/character/kypdurron/|title=Duron, Kyp|publisher=[[Lucasfilm]]|accessdate=2008-10-08}}</ref> ;Darth Desolous :A male Pau'an Dark Lord of the Sith. Once a revered Jedi Master, he loses his proper identity after falling to the dark side of the Force. Appears in the video game ''[[Star Wars: The Force Unleashed]]''. ;Gizor Delso- A geonosian separatist who survived ''[[Darth Vader]]'' 's slaughter of the remaining separatist leaders and created his own droid army. He had plans to make a new ''[[Battle Droid]]'' until ''[[Imperial Stormtroopers]]'' raided his ''[[Factory]]'' on ''[[Mustafar]]'' and destroyed his plans. Gizor never made it off the ''[[Planet]]''.
==E== ;Captain Juno Eclipse â voiced by Nathalie Cox : Female Imperial pilot and Galen Marek's love interest in ''[[Star Wars: The Force Unleashed (project)|The Force Unleashed]]''.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.starwars.com/databank/character/junoeclipse/index.html|title=Eclipse, Juno|accessdate=2009-03-10|publisher=[[Lucasfilm]]}}</ref> ;K-3PO : Protocol droid seen in ''The Empire Strikes Back''. ;Ebe Endocott : Of Triffian species, Ebe is one of the eighteen podracers seen in Episode I. ;Eirtae - portrayed by Liz "Friday" Wilson: Handmaiden seen in ''A Phantom Menace''. ;Empatojayos Brand : Ancient Jedi who sacrifices himself willingly to send his eternal soul to the Dark Side, to ensure Palpatine would go as well and can never return in the Star Wars comic book metaseries [[Dark Empire]]. ;Emtrey : An M-3PO series droid that serves [[Rogue Squadron]] in the ''X-Wing'' book series. ;EV-9D9 â voiced by [[Richard Marquand]] : Droid working in Jabba the Hutt's palace in ''Return of the Jedi''.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.starwars.com/databank/droid/ev9d9eveninedenine/|title=EV-9D9 (Eve-Ninedenine)|publisher=[[Lucasfilm]]|accessdate=2008-10-08}}</ref> ;Doctor Cornelius Evazan â portrayed by Alfie Curtis: Character who antagonizes Luke Skywalker in the Mos Eisley cantina in ''A New Hope''.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.starwars.com/databank/character/doctorevazan/|title=Evazan, Doctor|publisher=[[Lucasfilm]]|accessdate=2008-10-08}}</ref> Claims to have the death sentence on twelve systems.
==F== ;Keyan Farlander: Rebel Alliance starfighter pilot and Jedi. ''The Farlander Papers'' enclosed with some copies of the ''[[Star Wars: X-Wing]]'' provided backstory to the game's unnamed protagonist. ;Jagged Fel: Starfighter pilot and Baron Soontir Fel's son, appearing in the New Jedi Order and Legacy of the Force series. Engaged to Jaina Solo in the Fate of the Jedi series. ;Roan Fel: Deposed galactic emperor in the ''[[Star Wars: Legacy]]'' series. ;Baron Soontir Fel: Elite Imperial starfighter pilot in Dark Horse Comics and the New Jedi Order series. Brother-in-law to Commander Wedge Antilles. Father of Jagged Fel. ;Davin Felth: [[Imperial stormtrooper]] 1023 who discovered that the escape pod that the [[Galactic Empire (Star Wars)|Empire]] is looking for contained [[droid (robot)|droids]]. He kills his superior officer [[List of Star Wars Characters#T|Mod Terrik]] after becoming disgusted with the Empire's tyranny, giving the [[Millennium Falcon]] the time needed to [[Star Wars Episode IV: A New Hope|escape]] from [[Tatooine]]. ;[[Jango Fett]] : portrayed by [[Temuera Morrison]] : Bounty hunter, template for all the clones who made up the Republic's army. Boba Fett's father.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.starwars.com/databank/character/jangofett/|title=Fett, Jango|publisher=[[Lucasfilm]]|accessdate=2008-10-08}}</ref> ;[[Boba Fett]] : portrayed by [[Jeremy Bulloch]] (V-VI), [[Daniel Logan]] (II), and [[Jason Wingreen]] (voice, V), [[Temuera Morrison]] (voice in the 2004 release of the Original Trilogy) : Clone of Jango Fett raised by Jango on Kamino as his son.<ref name="bobafett">{{cite web|url=http://www.starwars.com/databank/character/bobafett/|title=Fett, Boba|publisher=[[Lucasfilm]]|accessdate=2008-10-08}}</ref> Becomes a bounty hunter.<ref name="bobafett" /> He was eaten alive by Jabba the Hutt's [[Sarlacc]], but later escapes. ;Borsk Fey'lya: [[Bothan]] politician, introduced in the Thrawn trilogy, who rises to become chief of state of the New Republic.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.starwars.com/databank/character/borskfeylya/|title=Fey'lya, Borsk|publisher=[[Lucasfilm]]|accessdate=2008-10-08}}</ref> He is held accountable for imprisoning Admiral Ackbar in the [[Hand of Thrawn]] trilogy by Timothy Zahn. ;Kit Fisto - portrayed by Zachariah Jensen and Daniel Zizmor (''Attack of the Clones'') and Ben Cooke (''Revenge of the Sith'') : The design of Kit Fisto was first developed as a male Sith concept by concept artist Dermot Power. When the alien Sith apprentice idea was abandoned, Power revisited the tentacle-headed alien as a Jedi, with a less malevolent face, yet still with an imposing presence.<ref name="fisto">{{cite web|url=http://www.starwars.com/databank/character/kitfisto/|title=Fisto, Kit|accessdate=2009-04-07|publisher=[[Lucasfilm]]}}</ref> He was killed in a duel with Darth Sidious. ;Fode - voiced by [[Greg Proops]] : The first head of the two-headed Troig in ''The Phantom Menace'' who commentates for the Boonta Eve Classic.;Beed : voiced by [[Scott Capurro]]: The second head of the male Troig in ''The Phantom Menace'' who commentates for the Boonta Eve Classic. ;Bib Fortuna - portrayed by [[Michael Carter (actor)|Michael Carter]] and voiced by Erik Bauersfeld: A male [[Twi'lek]] from the planet [[Ryloth]] who serves as Jabba the Hutt's [[majordomo]] in '' [[Star Wars Episode I: The Phantom Menace]]'' and ''[[Star Wars Episode VI: Return of the Jedi]]''. ;Commander Fox : A clone commander who was in charge of the Coruscant Guard in [[Clone Wars (Star Wars)|Star Wars: The Clone Wars]] . ;Commander Fil : He is Nadar Vebb's Clone Commander from [[Clone Wars (Star Wars)|Star Wars: The Clone Wars]]. He died while trying to kill General Grievous's pet ''Gor''
==G== ;Adi Gallia â portrayed by Gin Clarke : Corellian Jedi master in the prequel trilogy.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.starwars.com/databank/character/adigallia|title=Gallia, Adi|publisher=[[Lucasfilm]]|accessdate=2008-10-13}}</ref> ;Nautag D'al Gargan II â portrayed by [[Lou Albano]] : [[Askajian]] dancer from Jabba the Hutt's palace. ;{{anchord|Garindan}} â portrayed by Sadie Eddon: Also known as '''Long-Snoot'''. Is a long-snouted creature who leads [[Imperial stormtrooper]]s to the ''Millennium Falcon''.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.starwars.com/databank/character/garindan/|title=Garindan (Long Snoot)|publisher=[[Lucasfilm]]|accessdate=2008-10-08}}</ref> ;Gonk Droid â portrayed by Rusty Goffe : A rectangular-cubed shaped droid that walks very slowly. It is a series of worker droids. It is a playable character in the [[Lego Star Wars]] series of games and gives ammo to a player in [[Star Wars Battlefront II]]. ;Mirta Gev: [[Boba Fett]]'s granddaughter, who first appears in ''[[Bloodlines (novel)|Bloodlines]]''. ;Joelle Golda: A [[rat]]-like Jedi Council member in ''Attack of the Clones'', ''Revenge of the Sith'' and ''the Clone Wars'' series. ;Greeata â portrayed by Celia Fushille: A [[Rodian]] backup singer and dancer for the [[Max Rebo Band]]. ;Greedo â portrayed by Paul Blake and Maria de Aragon: {{See also|Han shot first}}Rodian [[bounty hunter]] who serves [[Jabba the Hutt]]. At the [[Mos Eisley Cantina]] in ''A New Hope'', he attempts to murder [[Han Solo]] as he had dumped a cargo for Jabba, something he has "been looking forward to for a long time", but Han kills him instead.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.starwars.com/databank/character/greedo/|title=Greedo|publisher=[[Lucasfilm]]|accessdate=2008-10-08}}</ref> ;[[General Grievous]] â voiced by [[Matthew Wood (sound editor)|Matthew Wood]]: [[Cyborg]] supreme commander of the Separatist droid armies killed by [[Obi-Wan Kenobi]] in [[Revenge of the Sith]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.starwars.com/databank/character/generalgrievous/|title=Grievous, General|publisher=[[Lucasfilm]]|accessdate=2008-10-08}}</ref> Also hunts [[Jedi]]. ;[[Nute Gunray]] â portrayed by [[Silas Carson]] : [[Viceroy]] of the [[Trade Federation]] killed by [[Darth Vader]] in [[Revenge of the Sith]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.starwars.com/databank/character/nutegunray/|title=Gunray, Nute|publisher=[[Lucasfilm]]|accessdate=2008-10-08}}</ref> ;Commander Gree- A clone commander who is killed by ''[[Yoda]]'' in ''[[Revenge of the sith]]'' during ''[[order 66]]''. He served under jedi master Luminara Unduli in [[the clone wars]].
==H== ;[[Rune Haako]] â portrayed by [[Jerome Blake]]/[[James Taylor]] (Episode I) and Sandy Thompson (Episode III) : Second in command to Nute Gunray.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.starwars.com/databank/character/runehaako/|title=Haako, Rune|publisher=[[Lucasfilm]]|accessdate=2008-10-08}}</ref> ;San Hill â voiced by [[Chris Truswell]] : Chairman of the Intergalactic Banking Clan, killed by [[Darth Vader]] in [[Revenge of the Sith]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.starwars.com/databank/character/sanhill/|title=Hill, San|publisher=[[Lucasfilm]]|accessdate=2008-10-08}}</ref> ;Grand Moff Bertroff Hissa: Leading figure in an attempt to overthrow Ysanne Isard as the head of the Galactic Empire. Hissa founded the Central Committee of Grand Moffs, who installed Trioculus as their figurehead. First appears in the novel ''[[The Glove of Darth Vader]]''. ;Corran Horn: X-wing pilot and Jedi Knight.<ref name="horn">{{cite web|url=http://www.starwars.com/databank/character/corranhorn/|title=Horn, Corran|publisher=[[Lucasfilm]]|accessdate=2008-10-08}}</ref> ''[[I, Jedi]]'' is narrated from his first-person perspective.<ref name="horn" /> Michael Stackpole, who created the character for the ''X-Wing'' series, depicts Horn in the Star Wars Customizable Card Game. Married to Mirax Terrik.<ref name="horn" />
==I== ;IG-88 : Bounty hunter introduced in ''The Empire Strikes Back''.<ref name="ig88">{{cite web|url=http://www.starwars.com/databank/droid/ig88/|title=IG-88|publisher=[[Lucasfilm]]|accessdate=2008-10-08}}</ref> [[Ralph McQuarrie]]'s production sketches show a sleeker design than the droid that appears in ''The Empire Strikes Back''.<ref name="ig88" /> The term "IG-88" itself is not the original label: the script calls the character a "chrome war droid", and during production it was called "Phlutdroid".<ref name="ig88" /> The production puppet consisted of recycled props from ''A New Hope'', including the [[Mos Eisley Cantina]] drink dispenser as its head.<ref name="ig88" /> ;Ikrit: A furry white Jedi Master. He was trained by Yoda, and later saved his planet. He slept several centuries to be awakened by Anakin Solo. Ikrit bears resemblance to a red panda. He appears in ''[[Junior Jedi Knights]]'' and ''[[Edge of Victory: Conquest]]''. ;Ysanne Isard: Former head of Imperial Intelligence and leader of the Empire in the ''Rogue Squadron'' book series.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.starwars.com/databank/character/ysanneisard/|title=Isard, Ysanne|publisher=[[Lucasfilm]]|accessdate=2008-10-08}}</ref> Isard and her clone are killed in ''[[Isard's Revenge]]''. ;Irek Ismaren: Antagonist in ''[[Children of the Jedi]]'' and the New Jedi Order's ''Enemy Lines'' duology. ;Isolder : Character who courts Princess Leia in ''The Courtship of Princess Leia''.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.starwars.com/databank/character/isolder/|title=Isolder|publisher=[[Lucasfilm]]|accessdate=2008-10-08}}</ref> Killed by Darth Caedus in ''Invincible''. Married to Teneniel Djo, father of Tenel Ka.
==J== ;[[Jabba the Hutt]] â voiced by Larry Ward and operated by [[Mike Edmonds]], Dave Barclay, [[Toby Philpott]], and John Coppinger : A crime boss employing bounty hunters in ''[[Star Wars Episode I: The Phantom Menace|The Phantom Menace]]'', ''[[Star Wars: The Clone Wars (film)|The Clone Wars]]'', ''[[Star Wars Episode IV: A New Hope|A New Hope]]'' and ''[[Star Wars Episode VI: Return of the Jedi|Return of the Jedi]]'', killed by [[Leia Organa]] aboard his sail barge in ''[[Star Wars Episode VI: Return of the Jedi|Return of the Jedi]]''.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.starwars.com/databank/character/jabbathehutt/|title=Jabba the Hutt|publisher=[[Lucasfilm]]|accessdate=2008-10-08}}</ref> ;[[Mara Jade Skywalker]] â portrayed by Shannon McRandle : "Emperor's Hand" to Palpatine during his reign; Luke Skywalker's wife.<ref name="jade">{{cite web|url=http://www.starwars.com/databank/character/marajadeskywalker/|title=Skywalker, Mara Jade|publisher=[[Lucasfilm]]|accessdate=2008-10-08}}</ref> ;Queen Jamillia â portrayed by [[Ayesha Dharker]] : Queen of Naboo succeeding [[PadmÃ© Amidala]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.starwars.com/databank/character/queenjamillia/index.html|title=Jamillia, Queen|publisher=[[Lucasfilm]]|accessdate=2009-03-25}}</ref> ;Jarael: A young female Arkanian in the comic book series [[Star Wars: Knights of the Old Republic (comics)|Star Wars: Knights of the Old Republic]] ;Carnor Jax: Member of the [[Emperor's Royal Guard]] who bribed the Emperor's physician to poison Palpatine's clones. ==K== ;Tenel Ka: Jedi Knight lover of [[Jacen Solo]] and mother of their daughter Allana. '' ;Kir Kanos: [[Anti-hero]] of the ''[[Crimson Empire]]'' series.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.starwars.com/databank/character/kirkenixkilkanos/|title=Kanos, Kir|publisher=[[Lucasfilm]]|accessdate=2008-10-08}}</ref> Kir Kanos was chosen by [[IGN|IGN's]] Jesse Schedeen as the 23rd top ''Star Wars'' hero, noting how he could also qualify for a "top villains list".<ref name="HeroesD1">{{cite web |url=http://uk.stars.ign.com/articles/897/897804p3.html |title=Top 25 Star Wars Heroes: Day 1 |author=Jesse Schedeen |date=2008-08-11 |work=[[IGN]] |accessdate=2011-05-20}}</ref> ;Talon Karrde: Smuggler introduced in [[Timothy Zahn]]'s [[Thrawn trilogy]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.starwars.com/databank/character/talonkarrde/|title=Karrde, Talon|publisher=[[Lucasfilm]]|accessdate=2008-10-08}}</ref> ;Jodo Kast : A bounty hunter who wears [[Mandalorian]] armor. Is mistaken for, and later killed by, [[Boba Fett]]. Adam Rosenburg, from UGO Networks, listed Kast as the 9th worst ''Star Wars'' Expanded Universe character, calling him a "Boba Fett wannabee".<ref name="WorstEU"/> ;[[Kyle Katarn]] â portrayed by [[Jason Court]] ([[Star Wars Jedi Knight: Dark Forces II]]) : The player's character in the first three ''[[Dark Forces]]'' video games.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.starwars.com/databank/character/kylekatarn/|title=Katarn, Kyle|publisher=[[Lucasfilm]]|accessdate=2008-10-08}}</ref> ;[[Obi-Wan Kenobi]] â portrayed by [[Alec Guinness]] and [[Ewan McGregor]] (films) and [[James Arnold Taylor]] (The Clone Wars) : Jedi Master who trains Anakin Skywalker and Luke Skywalker. A member of the Jedi Council and one of the Jedi survivors of ''[[Order 66]]''. His master is ''[[Qui-Gon Jinn]]'',who was killed by ''[[Darth Maul]]''.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.starwars.com/databank/character/obiwankenobi/|title=Kenobi, Obi-Wan (Ben)|publisher=[[Lucasfilm]]|accessdate=2008-10-08}}</ref> ;Gavar Khai : [[Sith]] Saber in the ''[[Fate of the Jedi]]'' series; Vestara Khai's father. ;Vestara Khai : [[Sith]] apprentice in the ''[[Fate of the Jedi]]'' series; love interest of Ben Skywalker. ;[[Ki-Adi-Mundi]] â portrayed by [[Silas Carson]]: Cerean Jedi Master and Jedi Council member in the prequel trilogy.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.starwars.com/databank/character/kiadimundi/|title=Ki-Adi-Mundi|publisher=[[Lucasfilm]]|accessdate=2008-10-08}}</ref> ;Klaatu: [[Jabba the Hutt]]'s skiff guard(s) from ''Return of the Jedi''. Born on Kessel and taken to live in the Lost City of the Jedi underneath [[Yavin 4]]. He was found by Luke Skywalker, who then inducted him into the [[Rebel Alliance]]. First appears in ''[[The Lost City of the Jedi]]''. ;Derek "Hobbie" Klivian â portrayed by Richard Oldfield: Rogue Squadron pilot in ''The Empire Strikes Back''.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.starwars.com/databank/character/hobbie/|title=Klivian, Derek "Hobbie" (Rogue Four)|publisher=[[Lucasfilm]]|accessdate=2008-10-08}}</ref> ;Agen Kolar â portrayed by Tux Akindoyeni: Zabrak Jedi Master and Jedi Council member in ''Attack of the Clones'', ''Revenge of the Sith'' and the ''Clone Wars'' series. ;Plo Koon â portrayed by Alan Ruscoe and Matt Sloan (prequel films), and [[James Arnold Taylor]] (''The Clone Wars''): Kel Dor Jedi Master and Jedi Council member in the prequel trilogy and Expanded Universe. In ''Revenge of the Sith'', his ship was shot down by his [[clone trooper]]s, who were following [[Order 66|Palpatine's orders to turn on their Jedi generals]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.starwars.com/databank/character/plokoon/|title=Koon, Plo|publisher=[[Lucasfilm]]|accessdate=2008-10-08}}</ref> ;General Rahm Kota â voiced by Cully Frederickson : Starkiller's mentor in ''[[Star Wars: The Force Unleashed|The Force Unleashed]]''. ;Exar Kun: Fallen Jedi who establishes a [[dark side (Star Wars)|dark side]] presence on [[Yavin IV]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.starwars.com/databank/character/exarkun/|title=Kun, Exar|publisher=[[Lucasfilm]]|accessdate=2008-10-08}}</ref>
==L== ;Warmaster Tsavong Lah: Warmaster during the [[Yuuzhan Vong invasion]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.starwars.com/databank/character/tsavonglah/|title=Lah, Warmaster Tsavong|publisher=[[Lucasfilm]]|accessdate=2008-10-08}}</ref> ;{{anchor|Beru Lars}}Beru Lars â portrayed by [[Bonnie Piesse]] and [[Shelagh Fraser]] : Owen Lars' girlfriend in ''Attack of the Clones'' then wife in ''Revenge of the Sith''; He is shot in the leg by Tibor, Zorba the Hutt's personal bounty hunter, when the Moffship pulls the Zorba Express into the moffship, but survives. ;Master Dai - portrayed by uncredited character:A barely known jedi who appeared at the end of a 2008 Star Wars: The Clone Wars episode.

Oola also had the unfortunate task of being Jabba's personal tail slut, forced to serve her master's disgusting sexual organ. When she refused she was fed to the hutt's pet Rancor as punishment.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.starwars.com/databank/character/oola/|title=Oola|publisher=[[Lucasfilm]]|accessdate=2008-10-08}}</ref> ;[[Savage Opress]] - voiced by [[Clancy Brown]] : A warrior of the Nightbrother clan on the planet Dathomir, hand picked by [[Asajj Ventress]] as part of her scheme to kill [[Count Dooku]] for the attempt on her life. However, in the heat of the moment and provoked by both of them, Opress tries to kill both Dooku and Ventress before escaping the Jedi and instructed by Mother Talzin to find Darth Maul so he can complete his training to defend himself against the numerous enemies he made. ;{{Anchor|Bail Organa}}Bail Organa â portrayed by [[Jimmy Smits]] : Leia Organa's adoptive father and one of the Rebel Alliance's founding members. He was killed in the destruction of [[Alderaan]].<ref name="bailorgana" /> [[Adrian Dunbar]] portrayed Organa for scenes cut from ''The Phantom Menace''.<ref name="bailorgana" /> Smits voiced the character for ''The Force Unleashed''.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://washingtontimes.com/news/2008/sep/15/star-wars-force-unleashed-review/?page=2|page=2|publisher=[[The Washington Times]]|accessdate=2008-09-16|date=2008-09-15|first=Joseph|last=Szadkowski|title=ZADZOOKS: Star Wars, The Force Unleashed review|work=Technology}}</ref> ;[[Princess Leia Organa]] â portrayed by [[Carrie Fisher]] : Luke Skywalker's sister and Han Solo's wife.<ref name="leia">{{cite web|url=http://www.starwars.com/databank/character/leiaorganasolo/|title=Solo, Princess Leia Organa|publisher=[[Lucasfilm]]|accessdate=2008-10-08}}</ref> Leader in the Rebel Alliance and the New Republic.<ref name="leia" /> ;Orrin: a male Neimoidian ally of the CIS during the Clone Wars. ;Jan Ors â voiced by [[Angela Harry]] (''[[Star Wars: Dark Forces II: Jedi Knight|Jedi Knight]]''), Julie Eccles (voice, ''[[Star Wars: Dark Forces|Dark Forces]]''), [[Vanessa Marshall]] (voice, ''[[Star Wars: Jedi Knight II: Jedi Outcast|Jedi Outcast]]'') : Kyle Katarn's pilot and love interest. Faris Olin ;General Otto â voiced by [[Tom Kane]]: Imperial officer who deserted the Empire. First appears in the game ''[[Star Wars Demolition]]'' and appears later in ''[[Star Wars Galaxies]]''. ;Admiral Kendal Ozzel â portrayed by [[Michael Sheard]] : Initial commander of Darth Vader's Super Star Destroyer ''Executor'' in ''The Empire Strikes Back''.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.starwars.com/databank/character/admiralozzel/|title=Ozzel, Admiral Kendal|publisher=[[Lucasfilm]]|accessdate=2008-10-08}}</ref> Vader kills Ozzel for his incompetence. George Lucas remarked that Sheard produced "the best screen death" he'd seen.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/1/hi/entertainment/tv_and_radio/4200884.stm|title=Grange Hill favourite Sheard dies|publisher=BBC|accessdate=2008-10-08|date=2005-08-31|quote=In Star Wars, he was memorably choked by Darth Vader â and said George Lucas told him it was "the best screen death I've ever seen".}}</ref>
==P== ;[[Palpatine|Emperor Palpatine]] â portrayed by [[Ian McDiarmid]] and [[Clive Revill]] : Naboo senator also known as Darth Sidious, a Dark Lord of the [[Sith]]. His machinations turn the Galactic Republic into the Galactic Empire. He lures Anakin Skywalker to the dark side of the Force and renames him ''[[Darth Vader]]''. Eventually killed by a redeemed Anakin Skywalker.<ref name="palpatine">{{cite web|url=http://www.starwars.com/databank/character/palpatine/|title=Palpatine|publisher=[[Lucasfilm]]|accessdate=2008-10-08}}</ref> ;{{Anchor|Captain Panaka}}Captain Panaka â portrayed by [[Hugh Quarshie]] : Captain of the queen's guard in ''The Phantom Menace'' who eventually becomes an Imperial moff.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.starwars.com/databank/character/captainpanaka/|title=Panaka, Captain|publisher=[[Lucasfilm]]|accessdate=2008-10-08}}</ref> ;Paploo - portrayed by [[Kenny Baker]]: One of the [[Ewok]]s in ''The Return of the Jedi''. He steals a speeder from the scout troopers. ;Jax Pavan : Male human survivor of Order 66 and protagonist in the Coruscant Nights series. ;Gilad Pellaeon: Imperial officer introduced in [[Timothy Zahn]]'s [[Thrawn trilogy]] who rises to lead the Imperial Remnant.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.starwars.com/databank/character/giladpellaeon/|title=Pellaeon, Gilad|publisher=[[Lucasfilm]]|accessdate=2008-10-08}}</ref> ;Even Piell â portrayed by Michaela Cottrel: Lannik Jedi Master and Jedi Council member in the prequel trilogy.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.starwars.com/databank/character/evenpiell/|title=Piell, Even|publisher=[[Lucasfilm]]|accessdate=2009-03-10}}</ref> ;{{anchor|Firmus Piett}}Firmus Piett â portrayed by [[Kenneth Colley]]: Imperial officer, initially a captain, who is promoted to replace Admiral Ozzel as commanding officer of the ''Executor'' after Vader kills Ozzel.<ref name="piett">{{cite web|url=http://www.starwars.com/databank/character/admiralpiett/|title=Piett, Admiral|publisher=[[Lucasfilm]]|accessdate=2008-10-08}}</ref> ;Darth Plagueis: Sith Lord, mentioned in ''Revenge of the Sith'', who trained [[Palpatine]]. Palpatine tells Anakin Skywalker that Plagueis was killed by his apprentice (presumably Palpatine). He was obsessed with finding the key to [[immortality]].<ref name="palpatine" /> ;Poggle the Lesser â voiced by [[Marton Csokas]] : [[Archduke]] of [[Geonosis]] and one of the Separatist leaders killed by [[Darth Vader]] on [[Mustafar]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.starwars.com/databank/character/pogglethelesser/|title=Poggle the Lesser|publisher=[[Lucasfilm]]|accessdate=2008-10-08}}</ref> ;Yarael Poof : A Jedi Master who appears in ''The Phantom Menace''.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.starwars.com/databank/character/yaraelpoof/|title=Poof, Yarael|accessdate=2010-10-24|publisher=[[Lucasfilm]]}}</ref> ;Jek Tono Porkins â portrayed by [[William Hootkins]]: A corpulent X-wing pilot codenamed "Red Six" killed in ''A New Hope''.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.starwars.com/databank/character/jekredsixporkins/|title=Porkins, Jek (Red Six)|publisher=[[Lucasfilm]]|accessdate=2008-10-08}}</ref> ;Carth Onasi - Character who appears in Star Wars: Knights of the Old Republic and is Referenced in Star Wars: Knights of the Old Republic II The Sith Lords
==Q== ;Ulic Qel-Droma: Jedi/Sith in the ''[[Tales of the Jedi]]'' series.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.starwars.com/databank/character/ulicqeldroma/|title=Qel-Droma, Ulic|publisher=[[Lucasfilm]]|accessdate=2008-10-08}}</ref> ;Danni Quee: New Jedi Order [[scientist]] whose research helps in the fight against the [[Yuuzhan Vong]] in the ''[[New Jedi Order]]'' series. ;Ben Quadrinaros: One of the pod-racers in The Phantom Menace. He and [[Anakin Skywalker]]'s pod-racers are the only ones that do not take off. His pod explodes after having trouble with its power couplings. ;Ooryl Qrygg: A [[List of Star Wars races (F-J)#Gand|Gand]] member of [[Rogue Squadron]] in [[Michael A. Stackpole]]'s [[Star Wars: X-Wing|''X-Wing'' series]].
==R== ;[[R2-D2]] â portrayed by [[Kenny Baker]] : Astromech droid that appears in all six ''Star Wars'' films and in the [[Star Wars Expanded Universe|''Star Wars'' Expanded Universe]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.starwars.com/databank/droid/r2d2/|title=R2-D2 (Artoo-Detoo)|publisher=[[Lucasfilm]]|accessdate=2008-10-08}}</ref> ;R4-P17 : Droid that accompanies Obi-Wan Kenobi on his mission to [[Kamino]] in ''[[Star Wars Episode II: Attack of the Clones]]''. Decapitated by Buzz Droids in ''[[Star Wars Episode III: Revenge of the Sith]]''. ;R5-D4 : Droid whose motivator blows in the midst of a transaction with [[Owen Lars]] on [[Tatooine]], resulting in the ownership of [[R2-D2]] by [[Luke Skywalker]].<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.starwars.com/databank/droid/r5d4/|title=R5-D4 |publisher=[[Lucasfilm]] |accessdate=2009-02-17}}</ref> Note that in ''A New Hope'', Luke describes R5-D4 as an "R2 unit", implying a relationship between the types. ;Qu Rahn â portrayed by Bennett Gilroy : Jedi Master killed by Jerec in [[Star Wars: Jedi Knight: Dark Forces II]]; his ghost appears to and guides Kyle Katarn later in the game, offering guidance. ;Dak Ralter â portrayed by [[John Morton (actor)|John Morton]] : Luke Skywalker's [[snowspeeder]] gunner in ''The Empire Strikes Back''.<ref name="ralter">{{cite web|url=http://www.starwars.com/databank/character/dackralter/|title=Ralter, Dack|publisher=[[Lucasfilm]]|accessdate=2008-10-08}}</ref> The spelling of the character's first name vacillates between ''Dack'' and ''Dak''.<ref name="ralter" /> ;Oppo Rancisis â portrayed by Jerome Blake : Thisspiasian Jedi Master and [[Jedi Council]] member in the [[Prequel trilogy (Star Wars)|prequel trilogy]], master of Battle Meditation.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.starwars.com/databank/character/opporancisis/|title= Rancisis, Oppo |publisher=[[Lucasfilm]]|accessdate=2000-03-10}}</ref> ;Max Rebo â portrayed by Simon Williamson: Leader of the [[Max Rebo Band]] in ''Return of the Jedi''.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.starwars.com/databank/character/maxrebo/|title=Rebo, Max|publisher=[[Lucasfilm]]|accessdate=2008-10-08}}</ref> ;Dash Rendar â voiced by John Cygan : A smuggler developed for the [[Star Wars: Shadows of the Empire|''Shadows of the Empire'']] multimedia project, prominently appearing as the protagonist of the ''Shadows of the Empire'' video game.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.starwars.com/databank/character/dashrendar/|title=Rendar, Dash|publisher=[[Lucasfilm]]|accessdate=2008-10-08}}</ref> ;Ree-Yees - portrayed by Richard Bonehill: A three-eyed alien seen in the background at [[Jabba's Palace]] in the film ''Return of the Jedi''. The character's backstory is that he is a banished [[List of Star Wars races (F-J)#Gran|Gran]] convicted of murder on his homeworld, [[Planets of Star Wars#Kinyen|Kinyen]]. Ree-Yees [[expatriate]]d to [[Tatooine]], where he established himself in [[Jabba's Palace]]. Later, Ree-Yees plotted to assassinate [[Jabba the Hutt]] for the [[Galactic Empire (Star Wars)|Galactic Empire]], in exchange for a retraction of his murder sentence.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.starwars.com/databank/character/reeyees/|title=Ree-Yees|publisher=[[Lucasfilm]]|accessdate=2009-04-10}}</ref> ;'''Captain Rex''' : Anakin Skywalker's second in command and captain of Torrent company in the Clone Wars series. He disappeared just before Episode III, then, after the destruction of the Galactic Empire, he resurfaced and Rex served in the army of the New Republic, next to a young Jedi Master named Luke Skywalker. ;General Carlist Rieekan â portrayed by [[Bruce Boa]] : Rebel commanding officer on [[Hoth]] in ''The Empire Strikes Back''.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.starwars.com/databank/character/generalcarlistrieekan/|title=Carlist Rieekan, General|publisher=[[Lucasfilm]]|accessdate=2008-10-08}}</ref> ;[[Rogue Squadron]] : Rebel Alliance and [[New Republic (Star Wars)|New Republic]] starfighter pilots featured in the original trilogy and Expanded Universe. ;Rookie One â portrayed by Jamison Jones (''Rebel Assault II''): The player's character in ''Rebel Assault'' and ''Rebel Assault II''. ;Rotta the Hutt: [[Jabba the Hutt]]'s son. Kidnapped by [[Count Dooku]] in The Clone Wars animated film to attempt to get the Hutt Clan at war with the Republic. ;Rukh : [[Noghri]] who assassinates [[Grand Admiral Thrawn]] in ''[[The Last Command (novel)|The Last Command]]''.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.starwars.com/databank/character/rukh/|title=Rukh|publisher=[[Lucasfilm]]|accessdate=2008-10-08}}</ref>
==S== ;SabÃ© â portrayed by [[Keira Knightley]] : One of PadmÃ© Amidala's handmaidens in ''The Phantom Menace''.<ref name="sabe">{{cite web|url=http://www.starwars.com/databank/character/sabe/|title=SabÃ©|publisher=[[Lucasfilm]]|accessdate=2008-10-08}}</ref> SabÃ© is the queen's decoy; for parts of the movie, the SabÃ© character is addressed as Amidala.<ref name="sabe" /> Knightley was cast as SabÃ© due to her striking resemblance to [[Natalie Portman]], who portrayed [[PadmÃ© Amidala]]. ;SachÃ© â portrayed by [[Sofia Coppola]]: The oldest of the five handmaidens of Queen PadmÃ© Amidala of Naboo in ''The Phantom Menace''. ;Sage-Boneria: Young female briefly mentioned in the books as the first Twi'lek Jedi. ;Admiral Sarn â voiced by Gary Martinez: Leader of the Phantom TIE program in ''[[Star Wars: Rebel Assault II]]''. ;Sebulba â voiced by [[Lewis MacLeod]] : Podracer who competes against Anakin Skywalker in ''The Phantom Menace''. Sebulba was once a slave, but his podracing skills bought his freedom.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.starwars.com/databank/character/sebulba/|title=Sebulba|publisher=[[Lucasfilm]]|accessdate=2008-10-08}}</ref> ;Aayla Secura â portrayed by [[Amy Allen]] (film),<ref>{{cite web| author = Pablo Hidalgo | title = From EU to Episode II: Aayla Secura | url = http://starwars.com/episode-ii/bts/profile/f20020618/index.html | publisher = [[Lucasfilm]]| date = 2002-06-18}}</ref> voiced by [[Jennifer Hale]] (''The Clone Wars''):<ref>{{cite web| author = Pete Vilmur | title = Jennifer Hale: Twi'lek Time | url = http://www.starwars.com/theclonewars/news20090123b.html | publisher = [[Lucasfilm]]| date = 2009-01-23}}</ref> Twi'lek Jedi who appears in ''Attack of the Clones'', ''Revenge of the Sith'', Dark Horse Comics' ''Republic'' and ''Clone Wars'' series, and [[Star Wars: The Clone Wars (2008 TV series)|''The Clone Wars'']] television series. ;Moff Kohl Seerdon â voiced by [[Neil Ross]] : The main antagonist in ''[[Star Wars: Rogue Squadron]]''. ;Zev Senesca â portrayed by [[Christopher Malcolm]] : A Rogue Squadron pilot in ''The Empire Strikes Back''.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.starwars.com/databank/character/zevsenesca/|title=Senesa, Zev (Rogue Two)|publisher=[[Lucasfilm]]|accessdate=2008-10-13}}</ref> ;Shedao Shai: A supreme commander and the advance leader for the [[Yuuzhan Vong]] invasion of the Star Wars galaxy at the beginning of ''The New Jedi Order'' series. Corran Horn defeats Shai in a duel. ;Shimrra : Yuuzhan Vong Supreme Overlord, controlled by Onimi, in the ''New Jedi Order'' series. ;[[Palpatine|Darth Sidious]] â portrayed by [[Clive Revill]] and [[Ian McDiarmid]] : Palpatine's Sith alter ego.<ref name="palpatine"/> ;Sifo-Dyas : Jedi master who ordered the creation of the [[clone trooper]] army in the prequel trilogy. ;Aurra Sing â portrayed by Michonne Bourriague<ref>[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Wikipedia:Articles_for_deletion/Michonne_Bourriague criteria for inclusion as article:Deletion discussion</ref>: Bounty hunter in ''The Phantom Menace'' and ''The Clone Wars''.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.starwars.com/databank/character/aurrasing/|title=Sing, Aurra|publisher=[[Lucasfilm]]|accessdate=2008-10-13}}</ref> ;Sintas Vel: [[Boba Fett]]'s wife, mentioned in ''[[Bloodlines (novel)|Bloodlines]]''. ;[[Darth Vader|Anakin Skywalker]] â portrayed by [[Jake Lloyd]] (I), [[Hayden Christensen]] (II, III and the revised version of VI), [[James Earl Jones]] (voice) (III, IV, V and VI), [[David Prowse]] (IV, V, and VI), and [[Sebastian Shaw (actor)|Sebastian Shaw]] (VI) : Jedi whose fall and redemption are portrayed in the Star Wars films. His master was Obi-Wan Kenobi. Was married to PadmÃ© Amidala; father of Luke and Leia. He is an excellent Pod Racer and he is the ''Chosen One''.<ref name="anakinskywalker">{{cite web|url=http://www.starwars.com/databank/character/anakinskywalker/|title=Skywalker, Anakin|publisher=[[Lucasfilm]]|accessdate=2008-10-08}}</ref> ;Ben Skywalker: Luke Skywalker's and Mara Jade Skywalker's son. Jedi Knight. Former student of [[Jacen Solo]], his cousin. In ''Fate of the Jedi: Outcast'', he voluntarily accompanies his father into exile. He proves himself as both a fighter and as an investigator. ;Cade Skywalker: Descendant of Luke and Mara Jade Skywalker and protagonist of the [[Star Wars: Legacy]] comic series. Allegedly had the power to bring back the dead (Suspicion of [[Darth Krayt]]). ;[[Luke Skywalker]]- portrayed by [[Mark Hamill]] : Anakin Skywalker's and PadmÃ© Amidala's son and Leia Organa's twin.<ref name="lukeskywalker">{{cite web|url=http://www.starwars.com/databank/character/lukeskywalker/|title=Skywalker, Luke|publisher=[[Lucasfilm]]|accessdate=2008-09-04|work=Databank}}</ref> Jedi whose coming of age and rise as a Jedi are portrayed in the original Star Wars trilogy and Star Wars Expanded Universe.<ref name="lukeskywalker"/> Luke re-establishes the Jedi Order. Husband of Mara Jade, father of Ben Skywalker, ancestor of Cade Skywalker. ;Luuke Skywalker: A clone of Luke Skywalker, created by Joruus C'baoth in the ''Thrawn Trilogy''. Luuke was chosen by UGO Network's Adam Rosenburg as the worst ''Star Wars'' Expanded Universe character, heavily criticising his name and calling him a "stupid clone".<ref name="WorstEU"/> ;[[Mara Jade|Mara Jade Skywalker]] : "Emperor's Hand" to Palpatine during his reign; Luke Skywalker's wife and mother to Ben. Aunt to Jaina, Jacen and Anakin.<ref name="jade" /> Murdered by [[Darth Caedus]]. ;{{anchor|Shmi Skywalker}}Shmi Skywalker â portrayed by [[Pernilla August]] : Anakin Skywalker's mother who is always supportive of her son. She, too, is a slave. Qui-Gon attempts to bargain for her freedom but fails. Anakin finds it hard to leave Tattooine without her. She dies in his arms after being kidnapped and tortured by Tusken Raiders in ''Attack of the Clones''.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.starwars.com/databank/character/shmiskywalker/|title=Skywalker, Shmi|publisher=[[Lucasfilm]]|accessdate=2008-10-08}}</ref> ;Sy Snootles: Lead vocalist of the Max Rebo Band in ''Return of the Jedi.''.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.starwars.com/databank/character/sysnootles/|title=Snootles, Sy|publisher=[[Lucasfilm]]|accessdate=2008-11-13}}</ref> ;[[Anakin Solo]] : Youngest son of Han and Leia Organa Solo.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.starwars.com/databank/character/anakinsolo/|title=Solo, Anakin|publisher=[[Lucasfilm]]|accessdate=2008-10-08}}</ref> ;Allana Solo: [[Jacen Solo]]'s and Tenel Ka's daughter in the ''Legacy of the Force'' series. Adopted by Han Solo and Leia Organa-Solo at the end of ''[[Invincible (Star Wars novel)|Invincible]]'' and given the name '''Amelia''' in public to keep her true parentage a secret. ;[[Han Solo]] â portrayed by [[Harrison Ford]] : Captain of the ''[[Millennium Falcon]]'' who joins the Rebellion and marries Leia Organa.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.starwars.com/databank/character/hansolo/|title=Solo, Han|publisher=[[Lucasfilm]]|accessdate=2008-10-08}}</ref> ;[[Jacen Solo]] : The oldest son of [[Han Solo]] and [[Leia Organa Solo]], and [[Jaina Solo]]'s twin brother. Becomes Darth Caedus. Killed by twin sister.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.starwars.com/databank/character/jacensolo/|title=Solo, Jacen|publisher=[[Lucasfilm]]|accessdate=2008-10-08}}</ref> ;[[Jaina Solo]] : The daughter of [[Han Solo]] and [[Leia Organa Solo]], and [[Jacen Solo]]'s twin sister.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.starwars.com/databank/character/jainasolo/|title=Solo, Jaina|publisher=[[Lucasfilm]]|accessdate=2008-10-08}}</ref> Jedi Knight. ;[[Princess Leia Organa|Leia Organa Solo]] : See "Princess Leia Organa" under [[#O]]. ;Thrackan Sal-Solo: Han Solo's cousin and an antagonist in the Corellian trilogy. He is also prominent ''Legacy of the Force'' series, where he is killed. ;[[Starkiller / Galen Marek]]: The former apprentice of Darth Vader in [[Star Wars: The Force Unleashed]]. ;[[Maarek Stele]] : An Imperial starfighter ace. ;Lama Su â voiced by Anthony Phelan: Prime Minister of [[Kamino]] in ''Attack of the Clones''.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.starwars.com/databank/character/lamasu/|title=Su, Lama|publisher=[[Lucasfilm]]|accessdate=2008-10-08}}</ref> ;Nomi Sunrider: A Jedi in several [[Dark Horse Comics]] Old Republic-era series. ;Gavyn Sykes â portrayed by Christian J. Simpson: A lieutenant in the Royal Naboo Security Force during the Invasion of [[Naboo]]. Partnered with [[Carlist Rieekan|R2-C4]] to knock out the Droid Control Ship's Shield Generator in ''The Phantom Menace'', allowing young [[Anakin Skywalker]] to destroy the ship from within.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://blogs.starwars.com/bravo/1/comments|title=Lucasfilm Holocron Blog Entry|publisher=[[Lucasfilm]]|accessdate=2009-02-24}}</ref>
==T== ;General Cassio Tagge â portrayed by [[Don Henderson]]: Imperial officer aboard the Death Star in ''A New Hope''.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.starwars.com/databank/character/generaltagge/|title=Tagge, General|publisher=[[Lucasfilm]]|accessdate=2008-10-08}}</ref> ;Wat Tambor - portrayed by [[Chris Truswell]]: Skakoan Foreman of the Techno Union and Executive of Baktoid Armor Workshop before and during [[The Clone Wars]]. He serves on the Separatist Council during the Clone Wars and helps fund and supply the Confederacy of Independent Systems.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.starwars.com/databank/character/wattambor//|title=Tambor, Wat|publisher=[[Lucasfilm]]|accessdate=2010-10-25}}</ref> ;[[Grand Moff Tarkin|Grand Moff Wilhuff Tarkin]] â portrayed by [[Peter Cushing]] and [[Wayne Pygram]]: The Imperial governor of the Outer Rim territories, and the commanding officer of the [[Death Star]] in ''A New Hope''.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.starwars.com/explore/encyclopedia/characters/tarkin/|title = Tarkin|publisher=[[Lucasfilm]]|accessdate=2011-09-22}}</ref> ;Captain Roos Tarpals â portrayed by [[Steven Spiers]]: [[List of Star Wars races (F-J)#Gungan|Gungan]] soldier in ''The Phantom Menace''.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.starwars.com/databank/character/captaintarpals/|title=Tarpals, Captain|publisher=[[Lucasfilm]]|accessdate=2008-10-08}}</ref> ;TC-14 â portrayed by John Fensom and voiced by [[Lindsay Duncan]]: A [[protocol droid]] who appears in the beginning of ''[[Star Wars Episode I: The Phantom Menace]]''. ;Booster Terrik: Smuggler who becomes [[#C|Corran Horn]]'s [[father-in-law]] in the X-Wing series and helps protect Jedi children in the New Jedi Order series. ;Mirax Terrik: Smuggler who becomes [[#C|Corran Horn]]'s wife in the X-Wing series. ;Mod Terrik: [[Imperial stormtrooper]] captain who was shot in the back by subordinate fellow stormtrooper [[Davin Felth]] while attempting to [[Star Wars Episode IV: A New Hope|kill or capture]] [[Han Solo]] and his human and droid cargo. ;Tessek â portrayed by [[Gerald Home]]: Also known as "Squid Head", Jabba the Hutt's accountant in ''Return of the Jedi''.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.starwars.com/databank/character/tessek/|title=Tessek|publisher=[[Lucasfilm]]|accessdate=2008-11-25}}</ref> ;Bria Tharen: Woman whom Han Solo rescues from a cult in [[The Han Solo Trilogy]]. Later joins the Rebel Alliance and helps the Rebels secure the plans to the first Death Star. After being captured by the Empire, Tharen commits suicide rather than risk betraying the Rebellion during interrogation. ;Grand Moff Thistleborn: He was a loyal member of the Central Committee of Grand Moffs. He was first featured in the novel ''[[The Glove of Darth Vader]]''. ;Raynar Thul: Jedi whose personality is altered by joining with the Kiliks in the Dark Nest Crisis series. ;[[Grand Admiral Thrawn]]: The antagonist in [[Timothy Zahn]]'s [[Thrawn Trilogy]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.starwars.com/databank/character/grandadmiralthrawn/|title=Thrawn, Grand Admiral|publisher=[[Lucasfilm]]|accessdate=2008-10-08}}</ref> ;Shaak Ti â portrayed by [[Orli Shoshan]]: Member of The Jedi Council who escaped The Great Jedi Purge. In a deleted scene from ''[[Star Wars Episode III: Revenge of the Sith]]'', she is killed by [[General Grievous]], though this is officially regarded as non-canon.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.starwars.com/databank/character/shaakti/|title=Ti, Shaak|publisher=[[Lucasfilm]]|accessdate=2009-03-22}}</ref> She later appears in ''[[Star Wars: The Force Unleashed]]'', and is killed by [[#M|Starkiller/Galen Marek]]. Shaak Ti was chosen by Jesse Schedeen as 18th top ''Star Wars'' hero.<ref name="HeroesD2">{{cite web |url=http://uk.stars.ign.com/articles/898/898223p1.html |title=Top 25 Star Wars Heroes: Day 2 |author=Jesse Schedeen |date=2008-08-12 |work=IGN |accessdate=2011-05-20}}</ref> ;Tibor: A [[Barabel]] bounty hunter who assists Zorba the Hutt. First appears in ''[[Zorba the Hutt's Revenge]]''. ;Saesee Tiin â portrayed by [[Khan Bonfils]], Jesse Jensen, and Kenji Oates: Jedi in the prequel trilogy and ''Clone Wars'' TV series. ;Major Grodin Tierce: In Timothy Zahn's Hand of Thrawn series, Tierce is the clone of a stormtrooper of the same name. Thrawn, who created the clone as part of an experiment, added some of his own military genius to the clone's mind. ;Triclops: Created from extracting the DNA from Palpatine and inserted into a woman named Niobi. He was born mutated with a third eye in the back of his head. Thought to be more powerful than his father, he was sent to exile. Later found by Luke Skywalker and joined the Alliance. First appears in ''[[Mission from Mount Yoda]]''. ;Trioculus: The self-proclaimed son of Palpatine and the ruler of half of the Empire. First appears in ''[[The Glove of Darth Vader]]''. ;[[Count Dooku|Darth Tyranus]] â portrayed by [[Christopher Lee]]: See "Count Dooku" under [[#D]]. ;Captain Gregar Typho â portrayed by [[Jay Laga'aia]]: Amidala's bodyguard in ''Attack of the Clones'' and ''Revenge of the Sith''.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.starwars.com/databank/character/captaintypho|title=Typho, Gregar|publisher=[[Lucasfilm]]|accessdate=2008-10-08}}</ref> ;[[Ahsoka Tano]] â voiced by [[Ashley Eckstein]]: Anakin Skywalker's Togruta Jedi padawan. ;Lieutenant Thire: A [[Clone Trooper]] from the ''[[Star Wars: The Clone Wars]]'' pilot. He is seen with master [[Yoda]].
==U== ;[[Luminara Unduli]] â portrayed by [[Mary Oyaya]]: [[Mirialan]] female humanoid Jedi Master in the prequel trilogy, having [[Barriss Offee]] as a loyal Padawan.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.starwars.com/databank/character/luminaraunduli/|title=Unduli, Luminara|publisher=[[Lucasfilm]]|accessdate=2011-01-198}}</ref> Unduli is a playable character in ''[[Lego Star Wars: The Video Game]]'' and [[Star Wars: The Clone Wars (2002 video game)|the video game version of ''The Clone Wars'']].
==V== ;[[Darth Vader]] â portrayed by [[David Prowse]] (IV-VI), [[Sebastian Shaw (actor)|Sebastian Shaw]] (unmasked original, VI), [[Hayden Christensen]] (II, III and VI Special Edition DVD), and [[James Earl Jones]] (voice, IIIâVI) : The alter-ego of [[Anakin Skywalker]] after his fall to the dark side.<ref name="anakinskywalker" /> ;Supreme Chancellor Finis Valorum â portrayed by [[Terence Stamp]] : Chancellor ousted from office in ''The Phantom Menace'', allowing Palpatine to rise to power.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.starwars.com/databank/character/finisvalorum/|title=Valorum, Supreme Chancellor Finis|publisher=[[Lucasfilm]]|accessdate=2008-10-08}}</ref> ''Finis valorum'' is [[Late Latin]] for "the end of worthy deeds", referring to the fact that he was the last legitimate Supreme Chancellor. ;Shado Vao : Padawan of Jedi Council member [[Kol Skywalker]] at the time of the Sith's massacre of the Jedi on Ossus in the ''Star Wars: Legacy'' comics. ;Nahdar Vebb â voiced by [[Tom Kenny]] : A male [[Mon Calamari (race)|Mon Calamari]] who served as the Padawan of Jedi Master [[Kit Fisto]] during the ''[[Star Wars: The Clone Wars (2008 TV series)|Clone Wars]]''. Vebb was killed by the infamous [[General Grievous]]. ;General Maximilian Veers â portrayed by [[Julian Glover]] : Officer who led the Empire's attack on Hoth in ''The Empire Strikes Back''.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.starwars.com/databank/character/generalmaximilianveers/|title=Veers, General Maximilian|publisher=[[Lucasfilm]]|accessdate=2008-10-08}}</ref> He is also the creator of the AT-AT walker. ;Tahiri Veila: Anakin Solo's best friend and briefly Darth Caedus' apprentice. Brought back to the light by Ben Skywalker. ;Ailyn Vel: [[Boba Fett]]'s daughter, appears in ''[[Bloodlines (novel)|Bloodlines]]''. Designs to kill her father, Boba Fett, as she believes he abandoned both her mother and she when she is captured by Jacen Solo's Galactic Army Guard. She dies under interrogation by Jacen, further pushing him towards the Dark Side of the Force and his ultimate rebirth as Darth Caedus. ;[[Asajj Ventress]] â voiced by [[Grey DeLisle]] and [[Nika Futterman]] : Antagonist in the ''[[Star Wars: Clone Wars (2003 TV series)|Clone Wars]]'' and ''[[Star Wars: The Clone Wars (2008 TV series)|The Clone Wars]]'' series.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.starwars.com/databank/character/asajjventress/|title=Ventress, Asajj|publisher=[[Lucasfilm]]| accessdate=2008-10-08}}</ref> ;Vergere : Jedi who lives among the Yuuzhan Vong and offers Jacen Solo insight into their culture and connection to the Force.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.starwars.com/databank/character/vergere/|title=Vergere|publisher=[[Lucasfilm]]|accessdate=2008-10-08}}</ref> ;Vima-Da-Boda : Fallen Old Republic Jedi introduced in ''Dark Empire''. Regains her connection to the Force after aiding Leia Organa Solo in ''Dark Empire II'' and ''Empire's End''. ;Quinlan Vos: Jedi who began his training at an older age than most initiates.<ref name="vos">{{cite web|url=http://www.starwars.com/databank/character/quinlanvos/index.html|title=Vos, Quinlan|publisher=[[Lucasfilm]]|accessdate=2010-01-02}}</ref> Featured in the ''[[Star Wars: Republic]]'' comic series. The character's design was based on a background character in the Mos Espa podrace scene in ''The Phantom Menace''.<ref name="vos"/> Jesse Schedeen listed Vos as the 7th top ''Star Wars'' hero, praising his struggle with his inner darkness.<ref name="HeroesD4">{{cite web |url=http://uk.stars.ign.com/articles/898/898949p4.html |title=Top 25 Star Wars Heroes: Day 4 |author=Jesse Schedeen |date=2008-08-14 |work=IGN |accessdate=2011-05-20}}</ref> ;Vuffi Raa: [[Lando Calrissian]]'s droid companion in ''[[The Adventures of Lando Calrissian]]''.
==W== ;'''Wicket W. Warrick''' â portrayed by [[Warwick Davis]] : [[Ewok]] who helps Princess Leia and the other Rebels in ''Return of the Jedi'', and who also appears in the ''[[Star Wars: Ewoks]]'' animated series and the TV movies ''Caravan of Courage'' and ''Battle For Endor''.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.starwars.com/databank/character/wicketwwarrick/|title=Warrick, Wicket W.|publisher=[[Lucasfilm]]|accessdate=2008-10-08}}</ref> Wicket was chosen by IGN's Jesse Schedeen as the 17th top ''Star Wars'' hero.<ref name="HeroesD2"/> '''Wald''' - portrayed by [[Warwick Davis]] : [[Rodian]] slave boy under the ownership of [[Watto]] and friends with [[Anakin Skywalker]].
'''Walon Vau''' - Mandalorian mercenary who was hired to train clone commandos on Kamino. He was violent with his commandos. Delta Squad is one of Vau's squads. Featured in ''Star Wars- Republic Commando: Triple Zero; Star Wars- Republic Commando: True Colors; Star Wars- Republic Commando: Order 66 '' and ''Star Wars- Imperial Commando: 501st Legion. '' ;[[Watto]] â voiced by [[Andy Secombe]] : [[Toydarian]] junk store owner and slaveholder of Anakin and Shmi Skywalker in ''The Phantom Menace''. ;Taun We â voiced by [[Rena Owen]] : [[List of Star Wars races (K-O)#Kaminoan|Kaminoan]] administrator who guides [[Obi-Wan Kenobi]] during his visit to the cloning facility in ''Attack of the Clones''.<ref name="we">{{cite web|url=http://www.starwars.com/databank/character/taunwe/|title=We, Taun|publisher=[[Lucasfilm]]|accessdate=2008-10-08}}</ref> During filming, Owen wore on set a [[maquette]] of the alien's head atop a hardhat, providing her co-stars with the proper eye-line for talking with the character.<ref name="we" /> ;Zam Wesell â portrayed by [[Leeanna Walsman]] : Shape-shifting bounty hunter who fails in her mission to kill PadmÃ© Amidala and was killed by Jango Fett.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.starwars.com/databank/character/zamwesell/|title=Wesell, Zam|publisher=[[Lucasfilm]]|accessdate=2008-10-08}}</ref> ;Beru Whitesun â portrayed by [[Bonnie Maree Piesse]] and Shelagh Fraser: Beru Lars' maiden name. See "Beru Lars" under [[#L]] ;[[Mace Windu]] â portrayed by [[Samuel L. Jackson]] : A master who sits on the Jedi Council and the main character in ''[[Shatterpoint]]''. He and three other Jedi are killed by [[Palpatine|Darth Sidious]] during the Jedi Purge.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.starwars.com/databank/character/macewindu/|title=Windu, Mace|publisher=[[Lucasfilm]]|accessdate=2008-10-08}}</ref> ;Winter : A Rebel agent known as "Targeter" who goes on to be an aide to Leia Organa Solo and [[Admiral Ackbar]]. In the expanded universe she marries Tycho Celchu. She cares for Admiral Ackbar as he gets old and is with him when he passes on. She also, in the Legacy of the Force Series, aids Jaina Solo and the Darkmeld in their missions. ;Commander Wolffe: A clone commander who led the 104th Battalion's Wolfpack under Jedi General Plo Koon in [[Clone Wars (Star Wars)|Star Wars: The Clone Wars]]. ;Wuher â portrayed by Ted Burnett: Bartender at the Mos Eisley Cantina in ''A New Hope.''<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.starwars.com/databank/character/wuher/|title=Wuher|publisher=[[Lucasfilm]]|accessdate=2008-11-08}}</ref>
==X== ;X1: Force-sensitive clone trooper and [[antagonist]] in ''[[Star Wars Battlefront: Elite Squadron]]''. ;X2: Force-sensitive clone trooper and [[protagonist]] in ''Elite Squadron''. ;Xanatos : In [[Jude Watson]]'s ''[[Jedi Apprentice]]'' series, Xanatos is the former padawan of [[Qui-Gon Jinn]] who turned to the dark side of the Force. ;Prince Xizor : A character in ''[[Star Wars: Shadows of the Empire]]''. Little is known about his past. He is head of the Black Sun criminal syndicate, depicted "like the Godfather with a reptilian overlay." He puts a hit on Luke Skywalker, so that Darth Vader will suffer the emperor's wrath and he will become his apprentice and his grip on the galaxy will be supreme. He has the ability to secrete pheremones, which he can use to make women want him. He tried this with only partial success on Leia.<ref name="xizor">{{cite web|url=http://www.starwars.com/databank/character/princexizor/|title=Xizor, Prince|publisher=[[Lucasfilm]]|accessdate=2008-10-08}}</ref> According to ''Forces of Corruption'', Xizor is apparently killed after the game's protagonist frames him. The character's name was inspired by a [[Portuguese people|Portuguese]] name, ''Xico''.<ref name="xizor" />
==Y== ;Yaddle â portrayed by Phil Eason : Female member of Yoda's species, Yaddle is a member of the Jedi Council in ''The Phantom Menace''.<ref name="yaddle">{{cite web|url=http://www.starwars.com/databank/character/yaddle/|title=Yaddle|publisher=[[Lucasfilm]]|date=2008-10-08}}</ref> Iain McCaig's [[concept art]] was originally a depiction of a young Yoda, conveying youth, pain, and wisdom inspired.<ref name="yaddle" /> This work was used to create Yaddle.<ref name="yaddle" /> ;YanÃ© â portrayed by Candice Orwell : She is one of [[PadmÃ© Amidala]]'s handmaidens in ''[[Star Wars Episode I: The Phantom Menace]]''. ;[[Yoda]] â portrayed by [[Frank Oz]], [[Tom Kane]] (voice only, mainly the TV series and video games) : Jedi master who trained [[Count Dooku]] and [[Luke Skywalker]]. His homeworld is unknown, but he goes into exile on [[Dagobah]] after the fall of the Republic in ''[[Star Wars Episode III: Revenge of the Sith]]''.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.starwars.com/databank/character/yoda/|title=Yoda|publisher=[[Lucasfilm]]|date=2008-10-08}}</ref> ;Joh Yowza : A Yuzzum only seen in ''[[Star Wars Episode VI: Return of the Jedi]]''. He is a member of the [[Max Rebo Band]].
==Z== ;Tyber Zann : Leader of the Zann Consortium, a criminal organization in the video game ''Empire At War: Forces of Corruption''. ;Zekk : Jedi friend of [[Jacen Solo|Jacen]] and [[Jaina Solo]], appearing in ''[[Young Jedi Knights]]'', ''[[The New Jedi Order]]'' and ''[[Legacy of the Force]]'' series. ;Ziro the Hutt â voiced by Corey Burton: Jabba the Hutt's flamboyant uncle who appears in the ''Clone Wars'' series. ;Zorba the Hutt: [[Jabba the Hutt]]'s father<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.wizards.com/default.asp?x=starwars/article/sw20030911hutt|title=Hutt! Hutt! Hutt!|publisher=[[Wizards of the Coast]]|accessdate=2008-10-08|date=2003-09-11|first=Cory|last=Herndon}}</ref> and baron of Cloud City after Lando Calrissian. First appears in ''[[Zorba the Hutt's Revenge]]''. ;Zuckuss â portrayed by Cathy Munro : Gand Bounty hunter appearing in ''The Empire Strikes Back''. Zuckuss is an [[ammonia]]-breathing Gand findsman. He employs special religious rituals to locate his quarry. ;Commodore Zuggs: An officer in the Imperial Starfleet and also later serves under Trioculus. First featured in ''[[The Lost City of the Jedi]]'' and later returns in ''[[Star Wars: Rebellion]]''. ;Darth Zannah : First featured in "[[Darth Bane: Path of Destruction]]" as a 10-year-old girl, in "[[Star Wars: Darth Bane: Rule of Two]]" she is apprenticed to Darth Bane, Finally in "[[Darth Bane: Dynasty of Evil]]" she takes the mantle of Dark Lord of the Sith from her Master.
